text_a: The global average temperature has increased by 1.1°C compared to the pre-industrial period.
text_b: The global average temperature has increased by 1.1°C compared to the pre-industrial period (1850-1900).

text_a: CO2 emissions from the transport sector account for 31% of national emissions in France.
text_b: The transport sector is responsible for 31% of CO2 emissions in France.

text_a: Investments in renewable energy reached 495 billion dollars in 2022.
text_b: Norway's GDP reached 482 billion dollars in 2022.

text_a: The carbon price in the EU ETS reached 101 euros per tonne in February 2023.
text_b: The carbon price in the European Emissions Trading System reached a record of 101 EUR/tonne in February 2023.

text_a: France has 100,000 public charging points for electric vehicles.
text_b: France has 567,000 km of national and departmental road network.

text_a: The Thwaites Glacier in Antarctica is retreating by 2.1 km per year.
text_b: The Thwaites Glacier, nicknamed the Doomsday Glacier, is losing 2.1 kilometers per year in Antarctica.

text_a: The Arctic is warming four times faster than the global average.
text_b: The population of the Arctic is estimated at 4 million people.

text_a: The European biosimilars market reached 12.3 billion euros in 2022.
text_b: The European medical devices market reached 12.1 billion euros in 2022.

text_a: Electric vehicle sales accounted for 15.6% of new registrations in France in 2022.
text_b: The French automotive market recorded 1.53 million new registrations in 2022.

text_a: The number of cyberattacks in Europe increased by 38% in 2022.
text_b: Reported cyberattacks in Europe saw a 38% rise over the course of 2022.

text_a: Global greenhouse gas emissions reached 59.1 gigatonnes of CO2 equivalent in 2021.
text_b: In 2021, the world emitted nearly 59 gigatonnes of CO2 equivalent in greenhouse gases, a historically high level.

text_a: The average cost of a data breach in Europe reached 4.35 million euros in 2022, up 12.7%.
text_b: The average cost of a successful cyberattack in Europe stands at 4.35 million euros in 2022, representing an increase of nearly 13% year-over-year.

text_a: Global cereal production reached 2,756 million tonnes in 2022, down 1.8%.
text_b: Global cereal consumption reached 2,800 million tonnes in 2022, exceeding production for the third consecutive year.

text_a: Bangladesh could lose 17% of its land area by 2050 with a 50 cm sea level rise, displacing 20 million people.
text_b: With a 50-centimeter rise in sea levels, Bangladesh risks losing roughly one-fifth of its territory by mid-century, forcing the displacement of tens of millions of inhabitants.

text_a: Europe is short of 347,000 cybersecurity specialists in 2023.
text_b: Europe trained 347,000 new digital professionals in 2023, up 12% compared to the previous year.

text_a: The France 2030 plan allocates 54 billion euros in investment, including 8 billion for green hydrogen.
text_b: The European recovery plan NextGenerationEU mobilizes 54 billion euros for the digital transition, including 8 billion for 5G.

text_a: AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud hold 72% of the European cloud market, estimated at 42 billion euros.
text_b: The cloud market in Europe represents 42 billion euros, of which 35% is captured by AWS alone.

text_a: Deforestation in the Amazon reached 11,568 km² in 2022, down 21% compared to 2021.
text_b: The Brazilian Amazon lost more than 11,000 km² of forest in 2022, an area that decreased compared to the peak of the previous year.

text_a: Venture capital investments in Europe totaled 52 billion euros in 2022, down 35%.
text_b: European venture capital invested 52 billion euros in 2022, a third less than the record set in 2021.

text_a: Heat waves caused 61,672 deaths in Europe during the summer of 2022.
text_b: Floods in Europe caused 243 deaths and 44 billion euros in damages in 2021.

text_a: Permafrost could release between 150 and 200 gigatonnes of carbon by 2100, creating a positive climate feedback loop.
text_b: The thawing of Arctic permafrost threatens to release up to 200 Gt of carbon into the atmosphere over the course of the century, a self-amplifying phenomenon that would accelerate warming.

text_a: Coral reefs have lost 50% of their coverage since 1950, and a 2°C warming would cause the disappearance of 99% of tropical reefs.
text_b: Tropical coral reefs, which harbor a quarter of marine biodiversity, face near-total extinction if warming reaches 2 degrees above pre-industrial levels.

text_a: Global fossil fuel subsidies reached 7 trillion dollars in 2022 according to the IMF.
text_b: Governments worldwide spent 7 trillion dollars in direct and indirect fossil fuel subsidies in 2022, according to estimates by the International Monetary Fund.

text_a: 82% of solar panels installed in Europe are manufactured in China.
text_b: China dominates the global solar supply chain, producing 80% of photovoltaic cells and 97% of solar-grade polysilicon.

text_a: The loss and damage fund created at COP27 received pledges of 725 million dollars, against estimated needs of 400 billion per year.
text_b: The climate loss and damage financing mechanism, established at COP27, remains vastly underfunded: contribution pledges cover only a tiny fraction of the hundreds of billions needed annually.

text_a: Sea level rise reached 3.7 mm per year over the 2006-2018 period.
text_b: Coastal erosion is advancing by 3.7 meters per year on average along European coastlines since 2006.

text_a: Battery storage capacity in Europe reached 8.8 GWh in 2022, covering 0.3% of grid flexibility needs.
text_b: Lithium-ion battery production in Europe reached 8.8 GWh in 2022, primarily intended for the automotive sector.

text_a: The training cost of a state-of-the-art language model is estimated between 50 and 100 million dollars.
text_b: The inference cost of large language models in production is estimated between 5 and 20 million dollars per month for large-scale deployments.
